arts.ttl: Liverpool 2-1 Everton ANALYSIS: Why Hugo Ekitike is a huge summer upgrade, the Reds man who is a 'manager's dream' and David Moyes' glaring problem
arts.sum: LEWIS STEELE AT ANFIELD: Liverpool took the bragging rights in the Merseyside derby on Saturday after Ryan Gravenberch and Ekitike netted in the first half for Arne Slot's men.

It was a fast start from the reds taking an early command of the game with Gravenberch opening the scoring with a delightful side volley which beat Jordan Pickford. Struggled to cope with Liverpool's early intensity in the first-half as Everton didn't have much of the ball but the midfielder battled throughout winning five ground duels, making five tackles and three clearances.

arts.ttl: Liverpool maintain perfect start after edging past rivals Everton
arts.sum: Goals from Ryan Gravenberch and Hugo Ekitike guided Liverpool to a 2-1 win against rivals Everton to maintain their perfect start in the Premier League with Arne Slot's side having now won their first five league matches this season.

arts.ttl: Arne Slot speaks highly of his scorers against Everton as Liverpool are in ‚Äòevolution‚Äô
arts.sum: In different ways, the two scorers for Liverpool in the Merseyside derby depict that the team is in "evolution." Arne Slot embraces that development, and he outlined its meaning to the media. Both goals were similar, in a similar area we attacked ‚Äì first with Ryan, second time with Hugo with the pace that these two players have.‚Äù

arts.ttl: Virgil van Dijk suggests 37-touch Liverpool ace was absolutely on fire against Everton
Premier League urged to change major rule after Liverpool vs Everton frustration boils over
arts.sum: Liverpool continued their 100% record this season with a 2-1 victory over Everton but David Moyes and his players were left angered at the end

arts.ttl: Arne Slot reveals key factor behind Liverpool win over Everton

arts.ttl: Arne Slot vindicated by ¬£209m Liverpool transfer decision after Everton win - 'Definitely necessary'
arts.sum: Arne Slot was impressed by goalscorer Hugo Ekitike as his Liverpool side continued their perfect start to the Premier League season with a 2-1 Merseyside derby win at home to Everton

arts.ttl: Opinion: Forget Gravenberch and Ekitike, 62-touch Liverpool player was at his best vs Everton
